intro: Dichosciadium, commonly known as the "dichosciadium" or "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, dandelion-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Dichosciadium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the sunflower family.
